intro: Spergularia sezer-zenginii, commonly known as the Turkish sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, red or pink berries that are edible. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
